review: I purchased the Apple TV after the HD version came out, V3 I suppose.  What I like is Netflix.  I won't watch Hulu, because you get less for the version you pay for than the free one, plus all the same commercials over and over drive me up the wall.  So, basically it's a Netflix box with a little bit of AirPlay or Air Parrot.  I rarely use this because I am too lazy to start it on my computer and move to the living room.  It's easier to watch Amazon Prime on my computer or my iPad.  I don't watch baseball (gasp!), NBA, or NHL, so those are worthless to me.  Also the just added ESPN and HBO are also totally worthless, as I have DirecTV.  What's with that?  So, I am being generous with the 3 stars only because for what it does for me, it does well.  I only wish Apple would quit treating ATV like a hobby and get serious about offering content.  There are reports of a deal with Time-Warner coming, but once again, worthless to me as I can't get TW. Apple, talk to DirecTV!! Please!!Bottom line, if all you are going to do is Netflix and AirPlay on your home network, it does this VERY WELL!  If you want more, maybe the new Roku 3 is the way to go.  I am thinking about adding one just for Amazon Prime Video and the slick headphone remote!
author: R. Allen

review: The Apple TV has more options than I had expected... Different apps for different streaming services.  The best part, though, unlike other players I've used, it seems to store what was streamed, so if I want to go back half a minute or so, I don't need to wait for it to reload the movie.  It is ready to go!  Nice job, Apple!  My only regret is that it does not have Amazon Prime streaming - still that competition with Google, I guess, since their devices are sold at Amazon.  My work around will be to try streaming from my iPad to the Apple TV, since I have an app for Amazon Prime there.  Haven't tried it yet, but will update if something does not work.  The iPad ll could not do this, but the iPad lll and later are supposed to-- a great excuse to upgrade the iPad!
